channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 东非酿酒厂生产肯尼亚约 90% 的国产酒。东非酿酒厂在酿酒业的主导地位只是该地区最大经济体如何被少数大公司的市场力量扭曲的一个例子。
item.description:
East African Breweries produces about 90% of the Kenya’s domestically brewed alcohol.

Its dominance of the brewing business is but one example of how the region’s biggest economy is distorted by the market power of a few big firms https://t.co/JRRPh8ITDf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 刚果 M23 叛乱运动有可能引发地区战争。最近，炮弹落在了戈马市外的流离失所者营地。前几次冲突的重演是一个令人担忧的前景👇。
item.description:
Congo’s M23 rebellion risks sparking regional war.

Fighting has already inflicted a heavy toll. Lately, artillery shells have been landing in camps for displaced people outside the city of Goma. A repeat of previous conflicts is an alarming prospect https://t.co/kHevWYmCbU 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 英国财政大臣杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）即将提交大选前的最后一份预算。他的后座议员要求减税，但资金紧张。怎么办？以下是一位假想的财政部官员的坦诚建议 👇
item.description:
Jeremy Hunt, Britain’s chancellor, will soon present what should be the last budget before the general election. His backbenchers are demanding tax cuts, but money is tight. What to do? Here’s the frank advice of an imaginary Treasury official https://t.co/1Va32CGSHv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 塞内加尔的法官已经取消了无限期推迟选举的总统令。这是对民主和法治的巨大推动，而在这个国家，民主和法治最近似乎都在退缩。但仍有一个问题👇。
item.description:
Senegal’s judges have cancelled a presidential decree that indefinitely postponed its election.

That is a tremendous boost to democracy and rule of law in a country where both had recently seemed in retreat. But there is still a wrinkle https://t.co/ZkW7zo6tBk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: "如果南卡罗莱纳州不是致命一击，那也不会太远"@imkahloon告诉 "The Intelligence "为什么尼基-黑利仍在与唐纳德-特朗普斗智斗勇，排除万难。收听播客： 👇
item.description:
“If South Carolina wasn't the fatal blow, it isn't very far away.” @imkahloon tells “The Intelligence” why Nikki Haley is still battling Donald Trump, against all odds. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/qeiuX1wgGr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 各国政府坚持要鼓励绿色转型。但他们的行动往往与此背道而驰 👇。
item.description:
Governments insist they want to encourage the green transition. Their actions too often say otherwise https://t.co/0rZgxKrLuA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 阿根廷的自由主义总统想要撕毁规则手册。他不应该 ⬇️
item.description:
Argentina’s libertarian president wants to rip up the rule book. He shouldn’t https://t.co/koeK0hitrS ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 周日，沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）说，自俄罗斯全面入侵以来，已有 3.1 万名乌克兰士兵丧生。关于俄罗斯士兵死亡人数的估计很难得到，但以下五张图表说明了巨大的损失
item.description:
On Sunday Volodymyr Zelensky said that 31,000 Ukrainian soldiers had been killed since Russia’s full-scale invasion. Estimates for how many Russian soldiers have died are hard to come by, but these five charts illustrate the enormous losses https://t.co/rhx8930tjQ pic.twitter.com/UkOB4B8evV

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 周日，沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）说，自俄罗斯全面入侵以来，已有 3.1 万名乌克兰士兵丧生。关于俄罗斯士兵死亡人数的估计很难得到，但以下五张图表说明了巨大的损失 ⬇️
item.description:
On Sunday Volodymyr Zelensky said that 31,000 Ukrainian soldiers had been killed since Russia’s full-scale invasion. Estimates for how many Russian soldiers have died are hard to come by, but these five charts illustrate the enormous losses https://t.co/gWEaiVWTkR ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 一篇新论文指出，出口商应对罗纳德-里根（Ronald Reagan）在 20 世纪 80 年代发出的类似威胁的方式可能为新的贸易战提供了借鉴👇。
item.description:
A new paper suggests that the way exporters responded to similar threats by Ronald Reagan in the 1980s may hold lessons for new trade wars https://t.co/O99DVVaB7H 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 加沙迄今已有约 29000 人在战争中丧生。但新的研究表明，在任何战斗停止后的很长一段时间内，死亡人数仍将继续增加 👇。
item.description:
Some 29,000 people in Gaza have died in the war so far. But new research suggests that fatalities will continue to mount long after any fighting stops https://t.co/2Es72HzSH4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 为什么北约对美国人重要？关于 "制衡"： @Gottemoeller 为北约辩护🎧 一个创始国退出北约🎧 我们的副主编谈唐纳德-特朗普的言论
item.description:
Why should NATO matter to Americans? On “Checks and Balance”: https://t.co/5jQKDWYj86

🎧 @Gottemoeller defends the alliance
🎧 When a founding member stepped back from NATO
🎧 Our deputy editor on Donald Trump’s comments

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: ♦️ 密歇根州州长支持乔-拜登（Joe Biden）。♦️ 尼基-海利（Nikki Haley）的资助者举行了务虚会。♦️ 共和党全国委员会主席辞职。请关注美国政治的最新动态：
item.description:
♦️ Michigan’s governor backs Joe Biden.

♦️ Nikki Haley’s funders retreat.

♦️ The chair of the Republican National Committee resigns.

Follow the latest in American politics: https://t.co/JLIMNBslJj pic.twitter.com/pdNI26V3B3

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 没有一杯咖啡，您是否难以开始您的早晨？我们有一些坏消息要告诉您 👇
item.description:
Do you struggle to start your morning without a cup of coffee? We have some bad news for you https://t.co/noumWOmEpx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 什么时候希望落空的行为会从令人钦佩变成荒谬？尼基-黑莉显然还没有，她是最后一个站出来反对唐纳德-特朗普及其夺取共和党总统候选人提名的女性👇。
item.description:
When does the act of hoping against hope go from admirable to absurd? Not yet apparently for Nikki Haley, the last woman left standing against Donald Trump and his seizure of the Republican Party’s presidential nomination https://t.co/abutcs6C8g 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: "风险可能没有那么极端是有原因的"在 "情报 "节目中@fsimcilwraith 解释了为什么交易商要把廉价天然气藏在乌克兰
item.description:
“There are reasons why the risks might not be so extreme.” On “The Intelligence” @fsimcilwraith explains why traders are stashing cheap natural gas in Ukraine https://t.co/G5nODGR5f7 pic.twitter.com/KVMMbjn7QK

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 尼基-黑利总统竞选活动的曲折夭折，反映了美国共和党中日益濒危的里根派路透社的命运。
item.description:
The tortured demise of Nikki Haley’s presidential campaign mirrors the fate of the increasingly endangered Reaganite wing of America’s Republican Party https://t.co/8EwcKfnXZe

Photo: Reuters pic.twitter.com/zivTAoHRR1

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 基尔-斯塔默爵士的传记揭示了这位改革者对政治的不适应。该传记认为，工党政府将为英国带来三种文化转变 👇。
item.description:
A biography of Sir Keir Starmer reveals a reformer ill at ease in politics. It suggests a Labour government would bring three cultural shifts to Britain https://t.co/SfPrENp4zj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普的地产公司将保持不变，但会受到限制。他将试图利用这一裁决来攻击乔-拜登👇。
item.description:
Donald Trump’s property firm will remain intact, but with constraints. He will try to use the ruling to attack Joe Biden https://t.co/jb5IPsTNPA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 2010 年代，由于投资者竞相从最热门的初创企业中分一杯羹，科技公司几乎不需要从公开市场获取资金。现在，投资者正在考虑如何出售昔日独角兽公司的股份🦄。
item.description:
In the 2010s, as investors raced to get a piece of the buzziest startups, tech ﬁrms had little need to tap public markets for capital. Now investors are mulling how to sell their stakes in the unicorns of yesteryear https://t.co/Mxbn3EmyqB 🦄

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 生理性男性可能具有哺乳的潜在能力，但他们的乳汁可能不具备生理性女性乳汁的所有营养 👇
item.description:
Biological males may have a latent capacity to breastfeed, but their milk might not have all the nutritional benefits of breast milk from biological women https://t.co/YFN1up6yTV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：尼基-黑莉为何排除万难与特朗普斗争、乌克兰的天然气储存套利机会和美国的表亲婚姻。收听每日播客： 🎧
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: why Nikki Haley keeps fighting Trump against all odds, gas-storage arbitrage opportunities in Ukraine and cousin marriage in America. Listen to the daily podcast: https://t.co/JZTVusXC5u 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）说，自俄罗斯两年前入侵以来，已有 3.1 万名乌克兰军人丧生。俄罗斯的损失要大得多--这五张图表让人看到了惨淡的一面 👇👇。
item.description:
Volodymyr Zelensky says that 31,000 Ukrainian troops have been killed since Russia’s invasion two years ago. Russia’s losses are far greater—these five charts give a bleak insight https://t.co/xjl6pmrAXO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 治疗 1 型糖尿病的方法即将问世？以下是实验室培育的转基因β细胞如何朝着正确方向迈出的一步： 👇
item.description:
Could a cure for type-1 diabetes be on the horizon? Here’s how lab-grown, genetically modified beta cells could offer a step in the right direction: https://t.co/25QRVRVcMp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 凯文-卡萨斯-萨莫拉（Kevin Casas-Zamora）警告说，在一个极度不确定的时代维护民主 "需要的不仅仅是防守"。
item.description:
Preserving democracy in an age of radical uncertainty “requires more than playing defence”, warns Kevin Casas-Zamora.

In a guest essay the political scientist argues that it is time to re-evaluate social contracts https://t.co/bt3mLF6lOl

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 当 @pursuitofprog 开始阻止 "恶霸 XL "狗时，他以为只需要几周时间。然而，他却收到了死亡威胁，还遭到了英国一些最受人爱戴的机构的反对。"周末情报 "讲述了他的故事 🎧
item.description:
When @pursuitofprog set out to stop the Bully XL dog, he thought it would take a couple of weeks. Instead he got death threats and came into opposition with some of Britain’s most beloved institutions. “The Weekend Intelligence” tells his story https://t.co/Vyfd943lEx 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰国内政治开始变得更加脆弱。阅读两年来不同寻常的政治团结如何让位于公开内讧👇。
item.description:
Ukraine’s domestic politics are beginning to look more fragile. Read how two years of unusual political unity have given way to public infighting https://t.co/rBvPRTmCLW 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 为了加强武装部队，欧洲国家面临着痛苦的支出调整。选择：征税、削减其他方面的开支或增加借贷 👇
item.description:
In order to bolster their armed forces, European countries face a painful adjustment to their spending. The choices: taxes, cuts elsewhere or more borrowing https://t.co/dZOGwuDYIT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 5 马赫是新的 1 马赫。正如昔日的飞行员寻求突破音障和超音速飞行一样，现在人们正在寻找 "高超音速 "飞行的可靠方法，"高超音速 "一般定义为音速的五倍以上👇。
item.description:
Mach 5 is the new Mach 1. Just as aviators of old sought to break the sound barrier and travel supersonically, the search is now on for reliable ways to travel “hypersonically”, generally defined as more than five times the speed of sound https://t.co/T3H2WLD7YX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 寻找下一本读物？这九本近期出版的历史类图书是该类型图书中的佼佼者👇。
item.description:
Looking for your next read? These nine recent books on history are some of the best the genre has to offer https://t.co/prOCpyBmvh 👇
